DataElement.preferredName: Disease International Classification of Diseases Diagnosis Staging Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the words related to the extent of the cancer within the body based on the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology used principally in tumor and cancer registries whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease International Classification of Diseases Staging Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the extent of the cancer within the body based on the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology used principally in tumor and cancer registries whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases Staging Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.:Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
